item.title: Trees in ML World
item.description: Trees are well-known as a non-linear data structure. They donâ€™t store data in a linear way. They organize data hierarchically. A tree is a collection of entities called nodes. Nodes are connected by edges. Each node contains a value or data, and it may or may not have a child node. The Image at the beginning of the article (Source) explains the terminologies of a Tree. Decision Trees Decision trees represent rules, which can be understood by humans and used in knowledge system such as database
